intro: Senecio platyphyllus var. glandulosus, commonly known as the glandular leaf senecio, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are covered in fine, glandular hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, typically during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its slow growth and compact form, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
